information:
This is a rematch for the UFC bantamweight title, scheduled to headline UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025, in Newark, New Jersey. In their first fight at UFC 306 in September 2024, Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by unanimous decision to win the championship. Commentator Joe Rogan has questioned how O'Malley gets past Dvalishvili's abilities, and former champion Henry Cejudo has referred to Dvalishvili as the greatest bantamweight of all time.

Merab Dvalishvili is the current UFC bantamweight champion and is on a 12-fight winning streak. His last fight was a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025, marking his first successful title defense. In the weeks leading up to the fight, Dvalishvili has reported suffering minor injuries to his finger and a toe on his right foot during training, but stated his intention to compete regardless.

Sean O'Malley is the former bantamweight champion. This fight will be his first since undergoing hip surgery in October 2024 following his loss to Dvalishvili. In preparation for the rematch, O'Malley has been sparring with former UFC middleweight champion Israel Adesanya. O'Malley has stated he is confident in his skills and expects to be significantly better than he was in the first fight post-surgery.

forecast.time_left_until_outcome_known: Approximately 12-13 days. UFC 316 is scheduled for June 7-8, 2025, and today is May 26, 2025.
forecast.status_quo_outcome: Yes - Merab Dvalishvili defeats Sean O'Malley. Dvalishvili is the current champion who won their first encounter convincingly by unanimous decision at UFC 306, is on a 12-fight winning streak, and just successfully defended his title against Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025.
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: The fight gets canceled due to Dvalishvili's reported finger and toe injuries worsening, or O'Malley's surgically repaired hip having complications. Alternatively, O'Malley significantly outperforms his first fight, utilizing improved striking and takedown defense to win by decision or knockout.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: Dvalishvili successfully employs his wrestling-heavy game plan that worked in the first fight, neutralizing O'Malley's striking advantage through relentless takedowns and control, winning by unanimous decision or late stoppage as O'Malley tires.
forecast.rationale: The status quo strongly favors Dvalishvili. He won their first fight convincingly, is on a 12-fight winning streak, and just defended his title in January 2025. In MMA rematches, the fighter who won the first encounter typically maintains an advantage, especially when the fight wasn't particularly close. Joe Rogan and Henry Cejudo's comments reflect the general consensus that Dvalishvili's wrestling-heavy style poses significant problems for O'Malley. However, several factors create uncertainty: (1) Minor injuries - Dvalishvili has reported finger and toe injuries, though he intends to compete. These could worsen or affect performance. (2) Fight cancellation risk - With injuries present and only 12 days until the event, there's meaningful risk the fight doesn't happen at all, which would resolve as No. (3) O'Malley's improvements - Post-hip surgery with 8 months recovery, O'Malley claims significant improvement and has been training with elite fighters like Israel Adesanya. Hip surgery could improve his mobility and performance. (4) MMA unpredictability - Upsets happen regularly in this sport. Why not higher: The injury concerns and possibility of last-minute cancellation prevent a higher forecast. Additionally, O'Malley is an elite striker who could catch Dvalishvili, and improvements from surgery are plausible. Why not lower: Dvalishvili's recent performance, winning streak, and first fight dominance suggest strong fundamentals. The stylistic matchup heavily favors his grappling-heavy approach. To revise higher: Clear confirmation both fighters are healthy and will compete, or news that O'Malley still struggles with the wrestling matchup in training. To revise lower: Worsening injury news for Dvalishvili, or credible reports that O'Malley has substantially improved his takedown defense.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will Merab Dvalishvili defeat Sean O'Malley at UFC 316?

Question background:
ESPN: [UFC 316: Dvalishvili vs. O'Malley 2](https://www.espn.com/mma/fightcenter/_/id/600053672/league/ufc)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if Merab Dvalishvili defeats Sean O'Malley at [UFC 316](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFC_316).

If Dvalishvili does not fight anyone at UFC 316 or fights someone else, this resolves as No.


Your research assistant's report says:
This is a rematch for the UFC bantamweight title, scheduled to headline UFC 316 on June 7-8, 2025, in Newark, New Jersey. In their first fight at UFC 306 in September 2024, Merab Dvalishvili defeated Sean O'Malley by unanimous decision to win the championship. Commentator Joe Rogan has questioned how O'Malley gets past Dvalishvili's abilities, and former champion Henry Cejudo has referred to Dvalishvili as the greatest bantamweight of all time.

Merab Dvalishvili is the current UFC bantamweight champion and is on a 12-fight winning streak. His last fight was a unanimous decision victory over Umar Nurmagomedov in January 2025, marking his first successful title defense. In the weeks leading up to the fight, Dvalishvili has reported suffering minor injuries to his finger and a toe on his right foot during training, but stated his intention to compete regardless.

Sean O'Malley is the former bantamweight champion. This fight will be his first since undergoing hip surgery in October 2024 following his loss to Dvalishvili. In preparation for the rematch, O'Malley has been sparring with former UFC middleweight champion Israel Adesanya. O'Malley has stated he is confident in his skills and expects to be significantly better than he was in the first fight post-surgery.

Today is 2025-05-26.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
